html: Those of Jehovah’s people who become “my people”—by renewing his covenant and keeping its terms—ultimately come to know Jehovah (Isaiah 19:21, 25). While knowing about him—based on exercising faith and receiving a testimony of him through his holy Spirit—constitutes a first step toward knowing him in person, in the millennial age, the “knowledge of Jehovah” that overspreads the earth (Isaiah 11:9) implies much more than a belief in him. At his coming, Jehovah reveals himself personally to his elect as he did to Moses and Israel’s elders (Exodus 24:9-11; Isaiah 24:23; cf. 6:1-8).
